alert.note: Alert for Bayfield (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 8:13PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bayfield, southwestern Ashland and northwestern Sawyer Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 812 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Seeley, or 9 miles northeast of Hayward, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cable around 820 PM CDT. Namekagon Lake around 830 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Namekagon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
